metadata.synopsis: Psychiatrist Dr. Weitzman (Dennis Boutsikaris) takes four mental patients on an outing to Yankee Stadium. Billy (Michael Keaton) is a nihilistic author, Henry (Christopher Lloyd) lost his bearings while working as a mailman, Jack (Peter Boyle) thinks he is the world's scapegoat and the childlike Albert (Stephen Furst) is obsessed with baseball broadcasts. When two corrupt cops incapacitate Dr. Weitzman, the four troubled men must fend for themselves amid the lunacy of New York City.

reviews: The Dream Team ultimately fares best in its affable and consistently watchable first half...
Hilarious and unexpectedly touching. A great vehicle for Keaton.
Romanticizing mental illness at its worst.
Yet another Keaton-related disaster. Get this guy a new agent!
Mental illness is no laughing matter, and neither is this film.
Strap youself in for a chunk of great laughs
A very underrated film, with Peter Boyle stealing the show.
even Keaton can't make this clunker click
A solid cast helps mold the material into something sweet.
This is not a bad starting place for a movie, but the filmmakers are unable to devise anything original for the patients to do once they've been set free.
